dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The annual Global CSR Forum just kicked off in Riyadh, and Saudi Minister Ahmad Al-Rajhi opened with some pretty ambitious goals.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The annual Global C S R Forum just kicked off in Riyadh, and Saudi Minister Ahmad Al-Rajhi opened with some pretty ambitious goals.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the opening of the Forum, Saudi Minister of Human Resources and Social Development, Ahmad Al-Rajhi highlighted Saudi Arabias vision to establish a world-class platform for social responsibility dialogue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he really emphasized the push for a world-class platform for social responsibility, didn't he? And that jump in social spending—from like 1.19% to over 4% by the end of this year? That's huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he really emphasized the push for a world-class platform for social responsibility, didn't he? And that jump in social spending-from like one point one nine percent to over four percent by the end of this year? That's huge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These contributions to social spending jumped from 1.19% in 2019 to 4.15% by the end of 2023, while the percentage of large companies with CSR programs jumped from 30% to 65% during the same period.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And it's not just about spending; he mentioned how companies are now integrating tech and circular economy principles into daily operations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And it's not just about spending; he mentioned how companies are now integrating tech and circular economy principles into daily operations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He underlined the growing trend of companies integrating technology, recycling, and circular economy principles into their daily operations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, like renewable energy and recycling. It's interesting how CSR has evolved beyond just charity into something more strategic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, like renewable energy and recycling. It's interesting how C S R has evolved beyond just charity into something more strategic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This shift includes renewable energy to drive environmental sustainability, human development, and balanced community growth.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And they've even set March 23rd as Social Responsibility Day to highlight private sector efforts. That's a concrete step toward building a national identity around this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And they've even set March twenty third as Social Responsibility Day to highlight private sector efforts. That's a concrete step toward building a national identity around this.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Furthermore, the Kingdom has declared March 23rd as Social Responsibility Day to showcase private sector efforts issued guidance for companies, developed a social responsibility index for the Saudi market, and fostered a shared national identity for social responsibility.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Plus that rise in the global ranking—from 41st to 16th in the IMD Competitiveness Index? That's a massive leap in just a few years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus that rise in the global ranking-from forty first to sixteenth in the I M D Competitiveness Index? That's a massive leap in just a few years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This progress is reflected in Saudi Arabia's improved global ranking, climbing to 16th place in the IMD World Competitiveness Yearbook 2024's Social Responsibility Index, up from 41st in 2021.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they're aiming for top ten by 2030. Ambitious, but with those numbers, it seems possible.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're aiming for top ten by twenty thirty. Ambitious, but with those numbers, it seems possible.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Minister was confident that Saudi Arabia will be even more highly rated among the top CSR countries in the world by 2030.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Speaking of the private sector, Rola Abu Maneah from Standard Chartered pointed out how ESG reports are boosting transparency for investors.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Speaking of the private sector, Rola Abu Maneah from Standard Chartered pointed out how E S G reports are boosting transparency for investors.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rola Abu Maneah, CEO of Standard Chartered Bank for the Middle East, agreed on the importance of the private sector to CSR: Voluntary Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) reports play a vital role in enhancing transparency and increasing investor awareness.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Brendan Nelson from Boeing stressed respecting local cultures while implementing CSR strategies—global mindset with local sensitivity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Brendan Nelson from Boeing stressed respecting local cultures while implementing C S R strategies-global mindset with local sensitivity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Maintaining company values and standards while respecting the cultures and regulations of host countries is equally essential.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Then there's HSBC's CEO Faris Al-Ghannam talking about their regenerative agriculture competition. Really tying CSR to regional priorities like food and water security.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Then there's H S B C's C E O Faris Al-Ghannam talking about their regenerative agriculture competition. Really tying C S R to regional priorities like food and water security.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are dedicated to nurturing Saudi talent and have introduced a competition to promote regenerative agriculture in partnership with a non-profit organization. We invite entrepreneurs to contribute innovative ideas focused on food and water security, aligning with the regions key priorities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It feels like the forum's theme—From Commitment to Impact"—is really being put into practice through these partnerships.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It feels like the forum's theme-From Commitment to Impact-is really being put into practice through these partnerships.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Minister was just one of an illustrious selection of speakers at the two-day forum, themed From Commitment to Impact, which was organized by the Saudi Ministry of Human Resources and Social Development.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. The ministry seems focused on turning dialogue into actionable models, especially with that national platform for reporting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. The ministry seems focused on turning dialogue into actionable models, especially with that national platform for reporting.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And you can see why—when large companies with CSR programs jumped from 30% to 65%, that's a cultural shift.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And you can see why-when large companies with C S R programs jumped from thirty percent to sixty five percent, that's a cultural shift.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These contributions to social spending jumped from 1.19% in 2019 to 4.15% by the end of 2023, while the percentage of large companies with CSR programs jumped from 30% to 65% during the same period.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Makes you wonder how other countries might learn from this model. Saudi's treating CSR as integral to national vision, not an add-on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Makes you wonder how other countries might learn from this model. Saudi's treating C S R as integral to national vision, not an add-on.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It's becoming part of their economic DNA, especially with Vision 2030 driving it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It's becoming part of their economic D N A, especially with Vision twenty thirty driving it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Minister hailed Saudi Arabia's progress in social responsibility as an inspiring story of transformation and empowerment, emphasizing the Kingdom's dedication to embedding it as a strategic goal within Saudi Vision 2030.

artist_script:
HostA: The annual Global CSR Forum just kicked off in Riyadh, and Saudi Minister Ahmad Al-Rajhi opened with some pretty ambitious goals.
HostB: Yeah, he really emphasized the push for a world-class platform for social responsibility, didn’t he? And that jump in social spending—from like 1.19% to over 4% by the end of this year? That’s huge.
HostA: Absolutely. And it’s not just about spending; he mentioned how companies are now integrating tech and circular economy principles into daily operations.
HostB: Right, like renewable energy and recycling. It’s interesting how CSR has evolved beyond just charity into something more strategic.
HostA: Exactly. And they’ve even set March 23rd as Social Responsibility Day to highlight private sector efforts. That’s a concrete step toward building a national identity around this.
HostB: Plus that rise in the global ranking—from 41st to 16th in the IMD Competitiveness Index? That’s a massive leap in just a few years.
HostA: And they’re aiming for top ten by 2030. Ambitious, but with those numbers, it seems possible.
HostB: Speaking of the private sector, Rola Abu Maneah from Standard Chartered pointed out how ESG reports are boosting transparency for investors.
HostA: Yeah, and Brendan Nelson from Boeing stressed respecting local cultures while implementing CSR strategies—global mindset with local sensitivity.
HostB: Then there’s HSBC’s CEO Faris Al-Ghannam talking about their regenerative agriculture competition. Really tying CSR to regional priorities like food and water security.
HostA: It feels like the forum’s theme—From Commitment to Impact"—is really being put into practice through these partnerships.
HostB: For sure. The ministry seems focused on turning dialogue into actionable models, especially with that national platform for reporting.
HostA: And you can see why—when large companies with CSR programs jumped from 30% to 65%, that’s a cultural shift.
HostB: Makes you wonder how other countries might learn from this model. Saudi’s treating CSR as integral to national vision, not an add-on.
HostA: Absolutely. It’s becoming part of their economic DNA, especially with Vision 2030 driving it.
